headline: Microwave Baked Potato
description: A microwave baked potato with delicious, slow-roasted taste? It's possible in just 12 minutes with this simple recipe and your microwave.

video.description: If you want the yummy taste of a slowly baked potato but aren't patient enough, or don't have the know-how to bake it in an oven, the recipe in this video is for you. Give it 12 minutes and get a mouthwatering, taste bud-tingling treat.
video.name: Microwave Baked Potato Recipe

name: Microwave Baked Potato
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Scrub potato and prick with a fork. Place on a microwave-safe plate.
Microwave on full power for 5 minutes. Turn potato over, and microwave until soft, about 5 more minutes.
Remove potato from the microwave, and cut in half lengthwise. Season with salt and pepper and mash up the inside a little with a fork.
Add butter and Cheddar cheese. Microwave until melted, about 1 more minute.
Top with sour cream, and serve.

review.reviewBody: This recipe, is an easy go to when in a hurry or not. I substituted the cheddar with pepper jack , then added broccoli . So filling. I love it.
Incinerated a perfectly nice russet potato and had to turn to instant mashed potatoes with a perfect bone-in rib eye.
‚ù§Ô∏èI absolutely love it!!!‚ù§Ô∏è It's one of the best ü•î's i've ever eaten!!

I just have to say that I LOVED this recipe!! I can't believe the stupidest comments regarding microwave time! It clearly says that times are different for different size potatoes and different strength microwaves!! Learn how to read! Microwave yourselves....
Super easy and very clear instructions! No one could mess this recipe up.
So easy and yummy üòã!
I did not have any sour cream, but it still tasted delightful. I paired it together with stewed beef.
After doing my potatoes like this for years, I will never go back to oven baking and waiting. Its senseless! This is the ONE exception to the rule that nothing is better cooked in the microwave...
Been doing this for years. 15 to 20 min. Check periodically for doneness.

Overcooked! WHO microwaves a potato for 10 minutes? You're not cooking pork. Microwave a pierced 6" potato for 6 minutes (turning unnecessary), wrap cooked potato in foil and leave potato on the counter for 6 minutes to allow the interior to finish cooking. (Potato can stay hot for 30 minutes!) Unwrap potato to add fixings. Don't waste your electricity by cooking a potato for more time than necessary! (From Littonware cookbook)
Simple , Easy , Tasty I had it as a second dish next to a homemade burger , added mayo , cheddar , butter . Thanks for the recipe!
Delicious, 5 mins each side works perfect for a medium potato üòÅ
Wrap the tater in a wet paper towel! Trust me!

Easy, quick, delicious. I topped mine with butter, a light sprinkling of regular table salt, pepper, shredded cheddar cheese, a couple of dollops of sour cream, and some microwaved California blend veggies. Oh so good. My size potato was about medium, so I had to cut down on the cooking time

That was a complete bust. My potato, when cut into, was practically hollow, it was so overcooked. And the ends were solid - hard as a rock. Perhaps 5 min on each side works if you‚Äôre cooking a bunch, but for just one baked potato, I suspect it wouldn‚Äôt take more than 2 min per side. Or perhaps you‚Äôre using an old microwave with less power than the newer. Regardless, my potato was inedible On another note, to read the lower reviews, it seems I would have to scroll to the end of the nearly 300 reviews. I saw no way to sort them so I could see what others had to say.
Burned turned black set off fire alarm in my Sons dorm room. Way to much time to cook. Poor hungry college student.
put it in for 5 minutes, flipped it, set the timer for another 5 minutes, 2 minutes in smoke fills my kitchen and the potato is burning. overall not bad. would not recommend for a 1AM fiasco though.

I need to update my review- id like to give this a zero. It was gummy, hard, chewy, just plain gross. There was not enough butter, salt, pepper, cheese, sour cream, or insert-topping-here on the planet to make this thing pallet-able. Stick w Ramen.
Turned out amazing. My wife and 2 boys loved it. I will make it again
Yeah, no. I stopped the microwave with two minutes to spare, because I saw smoke in the microwave. It was hard as a rock and almost on fire.

Someone give this person the Nobel Prize of Lunches! I have a 5-pound bag of russet potatoes that I have to use. They're too small for dinner-baked potatoes, and they're too small to justify warming up the oven an HOUR early for traditional baked potatoes. This works so incredibly well and I get a lovely hot lunch in under 15 minutes.

If you still want that crispy outside skin, you'll need to "finish" the potatoes in the oven for 5-10 minutes. Otherwise let them rest for a minute or two before pulling from the microwave and have at it! I love them. 

I'd caveat that this likely depends on your individual microwave, and most of us are doing this in home-style microwaves. If you're using an industrial microwave you might need less time as usually they go at MUCH higher wattage. (Warning because my office has industrial microwaves and even though I work from home now, there have been exploding-potato incidents in the past.)
Love the convenience of using the microwave for an easy and quick ‚Äúalmost baked‚Äù potato ;)

Be extra careful when using this method! Followed the instructions to a t and I still almost burned down my kitchen. Smoke literally everywhere! Definitely adjust your microwave settings and keep an eye on it, my poor potato was hard as a rock.
I like the recipe. However be careful about the size of your baking potato and adjust the time.
The first 5 minutes should‚Äôve been enough. I continued as directed and the second 5 minutes turn it into an impenetrable brick. Will try again but only 5 min.

The potato caught on fire. 

I suspected 4 minutes would be the basic time for a potato, but I thought it would be safer to double check with a highly rated recipe... Turns out it would be easier just to stick with my gut after all. My house is full of smoke. I just hope my mom's microwave isn't ruined.

I tried it with a Russet potato and with a red skin potato. I have a large over-the stove type microwave so both types of potatoes were done in just the first 5 minutes. I will definitely make it again. It's perfect for a quick and inexpensive homemade lunch.
almost set my house on fire.

Much too long cooking time. Start with four minutes, add two if not cooked. I suppose it depends on the power of the microwave, but this recipe resulted in inedible leather. Couldn't even cut it with a knife.

TERRIBLE RECIPE!! It's literally a fire hazard! I put my potato in for 5 minutes turned it and did another 5 minutes. The plate it was on shattered and almost caught the potato on fire. My apartment was full of smoke and the potato was hard as a rock. 10 minutes is WAY TOO LONG.
Ten minutes is too long Second time did 3 minutes turned over and another 3 and was better. I also wrapped in damp paper towel to keep skin from drying out

Yeahhh.... at 8:30 of total cooking (1100 watt microwave, highest power level as it said to do) the potato caught fire, smoked out my house, and ruined the microwave. DON‚ÄôT COOK A POTATO THIS WAY. For real.

i did exactly what the recipe said. i washed the potato and then used a fork to poke it and cooked it for 5 minutes, after that was up, i flipped it and then cooked for another five minutes. i walked into the kitchen and opened the microwave to find my black potato, black plate and black microwave with smoke coming out of it.
Its the perfect instructions for a single russet potatoe!
really easy and fast. Awesome recipie
I did not know you could make a baked potato in the microwave but it was good af. Definitely beats the oven if you don‚Äôt have a lot of time
yum! made one with vegan cheese and butter and put chives on top and it came out rlly good. perfect snack.

Idk how I‚Äôm even able to leave a review on this when I didn‚Äôt fully follow the recipe but here it goes haha I took commenter‚Äôs advice and wrapped my medium potato in a damp paper towel. Cooked it for 3 minutes. 2 minutes. Then 1minute. Rotating each time. Came out perfect!! My microwave is a 1000 watt.

great midnight snack.
loved it and I will use it again

I don‚Äôt know how this got 4 stars. I‚Äôve never had a bad recipe from Allrecipes but this one is awful. It basically shriveled up into one bite, lol. If you make this, wrap your potato in a towel or kitchen towel. And maybe start with 2 min, flip 2 min...the if needed another minute. I‚Äôve never overheated my microwave until I followed this recipe. Personally I won‚Äôt use this one again.
It started on fire
It came out very good, instead of using sour cream, I used greek yogurt because it's healthier
It always comes out wrinkly for me. It's not like the oven but I ran out of time. I guess it's cooked in the inside though so I ate that part with the cheese and sour cream. Oh well.
So easy and saved lots of time! Very tasty as well.

I don‚Äôt know if i did something severely wrong but i didn‚Äôt even put the potato in the microwave for all of the specified time and it almost caught on fire and the potato was ruined. kinda made me sad
I recommend covering the potato in olive oil after poking holes in it
Perfect amount of time to get an average russet potato perfectly cooked in my mikeywave. Tanks!
Worked perfectly! Thanks!
First five minutes were fine, second five minutes and my microwave was filled with gray smoke. I only bulked up on so much food for the Coronavirus and this is one less potato to fulfill my hunger :(

I didn't use sour cream because of 2 reasons. 1. I didn't have it & 2. I don't like it. I'm definitely gonna make this again & maybe next time I'll even use sour cream but i doubt it. My boyfriend took 1 look at it & tried to eat it b4 i could even take the pic. Lol.

I was trying to make a baked potato cuz I like potatoes. I picked the first recipe I could find to ensure I was cooking it for an appropriate amount of time. My innocent potato‚Äôs 10 minutes in the microwave has added 100 years of age to it - it is impossibly wrinkly and dried out. I pushed a fork at it and it simply sunk into itself. The reviews are more helpful than the recipe. I‚Äôll be sure to use a moist paper towel and give my potato some mercy from the heat next time. Please don‚Äôt submit your potato to the horrors of old age.

My potato caught on fire. I looked up why it would do that a people said that you shouldn‚Äôt cook it for more than 5 minutes in total. If you do it gets dry and starts to burn. You should never use this recipe unless you want a house fire.
Very convenient, did 5 and a half minutes each side since i had it plain and they turned out very well.
Worked perfectly. Just as good as a baked potato, but with way less effort.
This works perfect for me. You're going to have to adjust the time sometimes depending on the size of the potato though.

Anytime that I microwave anything, I stay in the kitchen and prepare other items it to eat! No fire in my microwave! That being said, I just microwaved three (3) medium size russet potatoes in an uncovered bowl with 1/4 cup water for 4 1/2 minutes, then flipped the potatoes and microwaved them for an additional 4 1/2 minutes. I wanted them softer, so I microwaved them for and additional 1 1/2 minutes. They came out perfectly. Thank you for posting this. I wanted cooked potatoes, but I didn‚Äôt have time time to bake them (which I normally do).

I have a 1,200 watt microwave so my potato only needed nine minutes. It was perfectly done. 

I scooped out the inside and made it in to a twice baked potato. I baked it at 350 for 25 minutes and it was crispy and delicious.
The skin was hard

I've been nuking potatoes over 20 years. Amazed at how many either don't know or haven't used this method. Saves goo gobs of time. Works well with sweet potatoes also. Only difference is if you like the crispy skin from the oven. My biggest change is bacon bits and chives or the green tops of scallions. Enjoy !
This is awesome and the best potato ever.
Added some onion and garlic powder.

This recipe just straight up does not work. Even with the correct settings on the microwave, the potato gets overcooked around the edges, causing the skin to lose all integrity but the center is still rock hard.

I made it and it was good, but I have the time and patience and I still prefer using the oven and making my baked potatoes the time tested way, with slower cooking at reasonable temperatures and enjoying the smell it brings to my kitchen. Thank you!

Perfect. Every. Time!
Follow this to the letter and you won‚Äôt miss. Fluffy and lovely every single time. We love it!

I used 3 smallish (a little larger than the size of my fist) golden potatoes. Microwaved at 3 minute intervals, turning each time, for 12 minutes. Followed the advice of rubbing with oil and salt, wrapping in a wet paper towel and setting in shallow dish with water. The potatoes came of soft and fluffy.
Fast, easy and delicious!!
What I do is just cut the microwave level down to about a 6 out of 10 and cook for an additional 8-10 minutes. I find that it comes out about the same as if it had been oven baked.
Was skeptical to use microwave but so glad I tried it! Such a time saver and turned out really nicely!
Made as per recipe. Liked it much. Will make it again.

Only needed 5 minutes total in the microwave, but they came out perfectly. Before wrapping in paper towel, I brushed with olive oil, and seasoned with Himalayan Sea Salt and garlic powder. After cooking, I let sit in microwave for 2 mins before fluffing them open with a fork. Then seasoned with a little butter and black pepper. Finally topped off with steamed kale, and a avocado and cilantro dressing. PERFECTION!!
10/10 simple n easy
Good recipe. Saves lots of baking time. I use 4 min. a side in the microwave then another 4 min. in the oven at 400¬∞.
I load it up with beans, broccoli, bacon, salsa, sour cream.
Quick, easy, and delish!
i'll make it all the time because my mom says "we have food at home"
Did as directed and after 10 minutes I got a rubbery shriveled dry mess that was simply inedible. Do not follow the directions as I did 10 minutes is too just long.
Kinda plain
Potato came our hard as a rock, inedible.

Good recipe, but the timing depends on the size of the potato. Also, I use spray oil on my potatoes and then coat them with salt before microwaving. Adds extra flavor and makes them a little more crusty on the outside!
This safe my life! I use everyone tips and it turned out perfect
Yum. I put some chili on it....amazing ??

So, I made it several times. The first time, I used a microwaveable plate and did the full ten minutes. The plate now has yellow spots on it from being burned, but I loved the potato. I tried putting water on the plate the next time, partway through the cooking process to cool the plate. The potato didn't cook all the way I wanted it to, but the plate didn't die. Most recently, I tried putting the potato in a clean rag and trying that. The rag burned, but the potato was amazing again. How can I get it to cook all the way and not burn the wrap or plate?

This was soooo good! I used olive oil and oregano to flavor the potato. Another reviewer added a tip to place a bit of water in bottom of plate to prevent drying out and it worked. Will be cooking another one tomorrow.
Excellent & easy. (Be careful - It‚Äôs gets hot!)
As they say on the side of cans, microwave ovens vary. We baked a potato for ten minutes and got a shriveled rubbery lump. Tried again for three minutes, and it was much better.
It works great!!!

2 rounds of 5 minutes was way too long. I baked 2 separate large potatoes in 2 separate microwaves at the same time. I followed instructions, but the second round of 5 minutes caused the potatoes to basically harden and overcook. 7 minutes as other recipes suggest would be better adding time only if absolutely needed.
Microwaved it for 5 minutes on each side and it caught on fire. Check potato after first 5 minutes be sure you don't have to open up the windows and turn on all the fans.
I didn't have any sour cream. Still very good!
Quick side dish for my husband

I cooked this for the 10 min it said to, the skin turned crispy...not necessarily a bad thing, but I like a softer skin. If I make this again I'll probably half the cook time. Especially cause the potato I used is sort of a medium to small potato. So that might have something to do w/ it.
Follow up with picture.
Very well done, an amazing cause to have as an afternoon snack or even just for dinner. Whoever the genius was who made this should be commended!

Ten minutes seemed too long for my medium sized potato. I cooked it on high for four minutes. I checked its softness and it was partly done. I turned it over and cooked it for 2 and a half minutes. I suggest that you take the size of the potato (s) and your own microwave when you decide on the cooking time. I thought this potato was very good and compares well to an oven baked potato.
Caught on fire in the microwave. 5 each side is way too long each side.
No, I almost burnt my house down. The inside of the potato is black and smoking. Worst recipe ever, all I wanted was a baked potato not a piece of charcoal.
Hard as a brick. Five minutes is more than enough for most potatoes.

I wrapped three potatoes in damp paper towels, and microwaved for three minutes on each side (total 6 minutes). Then I rubbed them with olive oil and salt and put them into the oven. I had stabbed them about 16 times each - overly cautious - before the microwave. Great recipe, easy, delicious!

OH MY GOODNESS - This is the best Baked Potatoes I have ever made!
I definely recommend putting each potato (if you are cooking more than one) in a separate sandwich bag with them poked by a fork. This will allow to steam and become softer in the microwave. 
Everything is right on with this recipe! I would recommend this to anyone who needs a good meal fast. This will give you a PERFECT Baked Potato in 10 minutes with guaranteed satisfaction! 
Love this recipe!
